intro: Pavetta sepium var. massaica, commonly known as the Massaica pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, black seeds.
